summary: Having covered the way energy flows between organisms in Topic 8.2, we will now focus in on populations, namely the different ways they can be analyzed. Topic 8.3 will also look at how populations grow in environments with abundant resources.

vocab.definition: A group of individuals of the same species living in the same geographic area at the same time
A measurement of the number of individuals (people or organisms) per unit of area
Describes the spatial distribution or spacing pattern of individuals within a population in their environment
A graph in population ecology showing the proportion of individuals from a group born at the same time that are still alive at each age
A graphical tool that visually represents the age and sex distribution of a population, providing insights into its birth rates, death rates, and growth trends
A model of population increase where the growth rate, or the number of individuals added per generation, is proportional to the current population size

videos.title: Crash Course Biology | Population Ecology: How We Saved the Bald Eagle
